intro: Rungia parviflora var. pectinata, commonly known as the pectinate rungia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom in clusters, producing a distinctive pectinate arrangement that gives the variety its name.
